column4: Hi, all. I'm having trouble getting my Feisty server working on my wired network. Checked the cables, etc. If I use DHCP, then the MAC address of the NIC shows up on my router's configuration page, but the hostname doesn't.
It can ping localhost, 127.0.0.1, or its own statically-assigned 192.168.2.x IP.
Can't ping the gateway, or ping the server from anywhere else.
Can anyone give me any advice?
Server. No UI.
starting from 1st principles here; can you ping the gateway when you have an IP assigned statically?
there's one NIC in this box?
there's a wireless NIC, which is unconfigured in /etc/network/interfaces, and down, and there's the wired one, which is configured and up.
can you show us the result of ifconfig eth0?
The wired one is eth1, so you want that, right? Just to check I'm not being stupid and making assumptions.
well actually just the result of ifconfig in this case
of course. One sec...
Want anything else while I'm chucking stuff across with the USB drive?
yeah maybe the output of route
right. Ta.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/30017/plain/ , and thanks again.
I've got that networking stuff for you, if you want?
I don't think there's an error there - what happens when you try to ping 192.168.2.1, what's the error?
From 192.168.2.100 imcp_seq=xx Destination Host Unreachable.
can you ping yourself on 127etc etc and also on your static ip 192.168.2.100? also what is the network card?
both, yes. It's a... Realtek Semiconductor Co., Lt. RTL-8139/8139C/8139C+ (r10).
